titles.title: Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
To award a Congressional Gold Medal, collectively, to the United States Merchant Mariners of World War II, in recognition of their dedicated and vital service during World War II.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Mr. San Nicolas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5671.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2020
This bill provides for a Congressional Gold Medal to be awarded to the U.S. Merchant Mariners of World War II, in recognition of their service during World War II.
Following the award of the medal, it shall be given to the American Merchant Marine Museum, where it shall be available for display and research.
